meanings.definition: The state of becoming hot or heating up.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside in the sun all day, the incalescence of my skin was noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The incalescence of the stove made the kitchen feel warm and cozy.
meanings.sent3: The incalescence of the hot chocolate was inviting on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent4: Her anger reached an incalescence that could not be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The incalescence of the bonfire lit up the night sky with warmth.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming incandescent or glowing with heat.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith's forge showed signs of incalescence as the metal heated up.
meanings.sent2: The incalescence of the lava flowing from the volcano was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The incalescence of the light bulb made the room bright and cheerful.
meanings.sent4: The incalescence of the sun on the horizon painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The incalescence of the campfire danced in the darkness, mesmerizing all who watched.
